thread.title: Tony Abbott’s new job at Washington Speakers Bureau will pay $40k per speech
thread.title_full: Tony Abbott’s new job at Washington Speakers Bureau will pay $40k per speech

author: Staff writer
title: Tony Abbott’s new job at Washington Speakers Bureau will pay $40k per speech
text:
All smiles: Tony Abbott has a new job, and its pretty awesome.
Staff writer news.com.au LESS than two months removed from the country’s top job, Tony Abbott is starting a new career. It’s expected to pay handsomely.
Mr Abbott is taking a well-trodden path to life after politics, following in the footsteps of former Australian prime minister John Howard, former French president Nicolas Sarkozy and former US president George W Bush.
All three are part of the Washington Speakers Bureau (WSB), a job that could pay as much as $300,000 per appearance.
The move was announced on the WSB website. The bureau described Mr Abbott as “an engaging, decisive leader during one of the most turbulent times in Australian politics.
“Tony Abbott provides timely and candid analysis of the most complex and critical issues facing our world today,” the website read.
“Tony Abbott served as Prime Minister of Australia from 2013 to 2015. Abbott’s government created over 300,000 jobs and oversaw free trade agreements signed with both Japan and South Korea.”
The former PM is expected to tackle topics including Australia’s response to terrorism in the 21st century, including the threat of ISIS, as well as global trade, the long-term future of China and the global economy.
According to the WSB website, Mr Howard received a minimum of $40,000 per speech.
The former prime minister was ousted in the September Liberal leadership spill that handed Malcolm Turnbull the top job.
